TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1212
TEI.2.document_title: John P. Coles to Stephen F. Austin, 09-29-1825

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1212

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Transmitting census.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="09-29-1825">29th September 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sih*/p*
*p*I have made out the Census of this *location_mentioned*district */location_mentioned*I have done It from the old list I think it pirty correct I wood be glad you could come up shortly and have those Transfers made among the *person_mentioned*Individuals */person_mentioned*they are expressing a great deal of anxiety to have It done I Expect you up *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1825">this fall*/date_mentioned* for that purpose I Informed *person_mentioned*Mr Whitesides*/person_mentioned* that I had his Deed and that the Labour was Included he says he will Transfer the Labour at any time no news among us*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jno P Coles*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col. S F Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p* */div1*
